paper_title.en: Corporate culture amid structural reforms of Japanese companies - Some lessons for significant alternative analysis

description.en: Adequate understanding of the Japanese corporate culture is considered as one of the basic steps to conduct comparative analyses of corporate performance. This study adopts quantitative analyses to investigate the relationship between corporate culture and their effect on the attitudes of employees engaged both in the middle-level management of business and engineering affairs. As a result of the study, it is found that there is a strong relationship between corporate culture and service providing attitude of employees. The degree of this relationship is getting stronger when it reflects that the enterprise makes much of human resource on the concerned corporate culture. It has become evident that corporate culture has still important positive roles both for the employee and the management. © 2008, Inderscience Publishers.

paper_title.ja: Environmental and Social Responsibilities of Banks: Global Perspective
paper_title.en: Environmental and Social Responsibilities of Banks : Global Perspective

description.ja: The main objective of this paper is to examine the environmental and social responsibility practices of corporate firms from the global perspectives for the promotion of environmentally and socially responsible business activities by banks in global economies. Topics reviewed in this paper include environmental and social responsibility (ESR) models; economies and importance of adopting ESR in banking business; existing global standards and principles on ESR of banks and practices by banks in global economies. Finally, the authors attempted to suggest a guiding framework for introducing and improving ESR activities by banks in the light of available literature on ESR standards.
description.en: The main objective of this paper is to examine the environmental and social responsibility practices of corporate firms from the global perspectives for the promotion of environmentally and socially responsible business activities by banks in global economies.
